did.unittitle: Library of Arabic Literature: Fellow Interviews
did.langmaterial: Interviews were conducted in both Arabic and English. Transcripts are in English.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: A program sponsored by the NYU Abu Dhabi Institute and funded by Tamkeen, the Library of Arabic Literature makes available Arabic editions and English translations of significant works of Arabic literature, with an emphasis on the seventh to nineteenth centuries.

Books in the series are edited and translated by internationally recognized scholars. They are published in parallel-text and English-only editions in both print and electronic formats. PDFs of Arabic editions are available for free download. The Library of Arabic Literature also publishes distinct scholarly editions with critical apparatus and a separate Arabic-only series aimed at young readers.
The program's ultimate goal is to introduce Arabic's rich literary heritage to a general audience of readers as well as to scholars and students.
Reference and for more information: libraryofarabicliterature.org

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Library of Arabic Literature: Fellow Interviews is a collection of video-recorded interviews with scholars awarded fellowships to contribute to the Library of Arabic Literature (LAL) publications. This particular collection of interviews were recorded between January and December of 2019, and includes six interviewees: Bilal Orfall, Mohammed Rustom, Maurice Pomerantz, Marcel Kurpershoek, Joseph Lowry and Julia Bray. Each interview session inclues a full interview, and a longer and shorter edited version prepared for social media. Some interview sessions were recorded separately, in Arabic and English.
Interviewees discuss the titles and texts they have worked on as part of their Fellowship with LAL. Most of the interviews are conducted by LAL Fellow and Editorial Board member Bilal Orfall.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in six series by interview session, and chronologically in the order of when the sessions took place.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Copies of these recordings are available on the Library of Arabic Literature Soundcloud and YouTube channels.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Original, preservation quality recordings are preserved in the NYUAD Library Digital Preservation Repository.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The videos were coordinated and produced by the Library of Arabic Literature program office and filmed by NYUAD Library, for eventual preservation as part of the NYUAD University Archives.

did.unittitle: Interview Session with Bilal Orfall and Mohammed Rustom

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Library of Arabic Literature Senior Fellow Mohammed Rustom talks to Library of Arabic Literature Senior Fellow BiLibrary of Arabic Literature Orfali at NYUAD about the texts Orfali is working on for Library of Arabic Literature, including al-Tawhidi and Miskawayh's al-Hawamil wal-shawamil (The Philosopher Responds) and al-Nisaburi's 'Uqala' al-majanin (Wise Madmen).
Interview recorded in the NYUAD Archives and Special Collections Reading Room by CDS Digital Specialist Rebecca Pittam.
